FuncDef:
The vpn-instance command binds a DHCPv6 server group to a VPN instance.
The undo vpn-instance command unbinds a DHCPv6 server group from a VPN instance. The vpn-instance command binds a DHCPv6 server group to a VPN instance. The undo vpn-instance command unbinds a DHCPv6 server group from a VPN instance. By default, no DHCPv6 server group is bound to a VPN instance. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. The VPN instance name cannot be _public_. The character string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

ExtraInfo: This command applies to DHCPv6 relay agents. To apply DHCPv6 services in a VPN instance, you need to run the vpn-instance command to bind the created DHCPv6 server group to the VPN instance.
